Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: fmackUk
Reviews.Content: I booked this based on the high, if not to say raving, reviews on this site. On this occasion, I have really been let down by TripAdvisor, as I believe this hotel to offer poor value for money. I know it's Sydney etc. so accommodation tends to be expensive, but the room was musty and dank, with furniture and carpets that were probably last changed decades ago. It was almost depressing, definitely not a cool room. Doors and doorknobs were grimy, and we had an ant invasion-all in the space of one night spent there. The so-called 'balcony' is just a verandah running alongside the room, so everyone who passes by is afforded a view of what you're doing. The whole place looks ramshackle and poorly maintained. I would never consider staying again, nor would I recommend the place. To be honest, I'd rather even spend a bit more and get somewhere halfway decent.

Reviews.Title: “The atmosphere is great”
Reviews.Author: Margaret N
Reviews.Content: A lovely weekend stay - quiet , peaceful and pretty decor, very comfy bed, very close to McMahon's point and ferry (about 20 mins walk), opposite a park where there was an interesting Saturday market. Continental Brekkie only $7 per head (put this on your web-site guys!) and good brekkie choices - more than adequate, served in an airy atrium room. Very pleasant helpful staff. Not pricey at all. Loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Blend of hotel and B&B - great value and location”
Reviews.Author: jaffle
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a couple of times now, and Owen really makes me feel welcome and is always happy to do the extra to make things work! Has a strange feel, more like a B & B than a hotel, and the reception closes at 11pm which can be a bugger if you are arriving in Sydney late! But the homey look and feel is nice too, and you feel "connected" with the place and the management as a result. I like it. The hotel is linked with nearby restaurants that can charge back to your room. I have always been in the rear section - large room, fabulous king size bed, but the en-suite is a little pokey and in my last stay was a bit musty - really due for a renovation I think. Having said that, at the price charged, with free parking and a dirt cheap and very nice breakfast, and the service, and the location, it still comes highly recommended by me! I would be happy to go back any time!

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: Sara H
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 separate stays in February and March whilst attending our son's wedding. Our son had found the hotel as he lives about 10 minutes walk away and other members of the wedding group visiting from UK stayed here too. The staff could not have been kinder or more helpful, Owen going the extra mile by bringing in a wonderful book to show us on discovering my husband's interest in they American Civil War. The rooms were kept immaculate by Suzi and her team and everyone was so pleasant and cheerful, it was like staying with friends. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Anne W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights as part of our New Zealand and Australia holiday. The staff were great, couldnt do enough for us. Convenient for transport etc.A very enjoyable stay. One point I would like to make, is that the rooms soft furnishings were getting rather shabby and need replacing, but other than that a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great position at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Cockerspanielfan
Reviews.Content: We needed somewhere to stay for a night just prior to New Year's Eve, with our 3 year old and 8 month old, as we were coming to Sydney for a function. McLaren Hotel was one of the only hotels close to Sydney CBD which would allow us to stay for one night. The Hotel is in a beautiful National Trust listed building just up from North Sydney CBD. The rooms themselves are a little dated, but they are perfectly comfortable and clean. We booked a large family room and brought our own port a cot. The room was huge, with an ensuite bathroom, and fridge in the room. It was more than big enough for the four of us. Breakfast was available for (I think) $7, in a lovely looking conservatory on the ground floor. We didn't have it as we were meeting family for breakfast elsewhere but next time we would definitely take this option up. The staff were delightful and extremely helpful, from booking, right through to our check in and check out. They were very welcoming to the children and very professional. It was also great that there was a car park under the hotel as the local streets have a lot of parking restrictions. Apart from the staff, the best thing about the hotel was its location. 1 minute walk from a bus stop with express buses to the city (about 10 minutes); 5 minute walk to North Sydney station; and 10 minute walk to Crows Nest, with its multitude of cafes and restaurants. Although the rooms were dated, for the price charged, this hotel can't be beaten. I have already recommended it to several family and friends and will be staying there for Sydney visits again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kim255059
Reviews.Content: Really nice boutique hotel in the heart of North Sydney. Walking distance from Nth Sydney railway station.Walk to Blues Point or Milsons Point. Good value and a great continental breakfast (only $7 pp). A very enjoyable stay. Extremely quiet during the night; would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: australianstig
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the CBD & a short walk to the best harbour in the world. The hotel is friendly & homely, although my room smelt 'musty' & 'damp'.. Apart from this, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and old fashioned but a little average”
Reviews.Author: rlazzara
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was just around the corner from the Australian Institute of Laser Eye Surgery where I had Lasik Surgery. You can get a discounted rate from the hotel if you are booked in to have Lasik Surgery and because of it's close proximity to the clinic it was a good choice on this occasion. However, it is in the commercial district of North Sydney so there is not much around in terms of restaurants, shopping or night life. There are a couple of restaurants within walking distance up the road and about a 10 minute walk to central North Sydney where there are a few shops and more choice for eating in the day but forget about it at night. Although the price is quite reasonable (I paid $150 a night) the hotel is quite old and run down and not my cup of tea. The rooms were large enough and comfortable but the first room I stayed in with a crappy fat back TV which was too snowy to watch so they moved me to another room which had a small 20" LCD which is a bit silly in this day and age and given the price of TV's now. The bathroom is very average with no real space to put things so it's a little akward but one thing I did like was the old fashined shower head which had good water pressure (just like home). The rooms have a poorly stocked mini bar but it's nice to have a fridge in the room to use. Wireless internet is available for the usual exuberant amount that hotels charge. The staff were nice enough and there is no restaurant on premises but they offer a cheap continental breakfast which is very average and not recommended. I wouldn't recommend staying here unless you were going to have Lasik surgery and needed a hotel nearby or had a business trip which required you to stay in this particular area of North Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug_Mike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs for a one night stay. Billy on reception was very pleasant and easy to deal with. The hotel itself, though old was absolutely immaculate and of course the age of the hotel was an attraction as much of its charm has been maintained. The light filled atrium/conservatory style breakfast dining area is very nice and the rooms are large and also very clean. Very handy for our needs, no diner provided at night but has a delivery menu for many restaurants in the area and pub and other food in walking distance. Would be happy to stay again if the need arose. Also had lovely large sitting room with magazines etc at front of hotel for relaxing and reading.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise in North Sydney”
Reviews.Author: takemetotheworld
Reviews.Content: Delightful old mansion conversion in McLaren Street and we were pleased to be issued to Room 27, on the ground floor, just off reception. No stairs to climb. Very welcoming reception, and as our room was not quite ready, we were ushered into the lounge and offered refreshments and a read of the Sunday papers. The location is great for business in North Sydney, however it is a bit of a hike from the railway station, and up hill. North Sydney is dead on the weekend. If you are looking for somewhere to eat, head to Milson't Point. This residence is very well priced. Room 27 is huge, with original features and an enormous bathroom and twin shower (!) Could do with more shelf space in bathroom and shower - no room for shampoo, conditioner, and other toiletries from home.

Reviews.Title: “A quaint old place - but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rozzimac
Reviews.Content: Arrived early but could get access to our room which was great. There is no lift so if you have large / heavy bags take them out of your car at the entrance to the hotel - rather than struggle with them up the stairs from the car park. Likewise - ask for a room on the ground floor. I'm sure the staff would help you get cases up stairs if needs be. (just a friendly word of advice.) Located in a very hand spot - easy walking distance to the hub of Miller Street etc in North Sydney. A spacious room that was rather tired and a bit run down - but you could open a balcony door and let in the fresh air! All the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basic but fine. Watch out for the carpark! It is tiny - and you could possibly be "parked in" as a tandem parking system operates. It is undercover - but not secure. It is first in best dressed!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, homely atmosphere with historic charm - one to remember !”
Reviews.Author: Will J
Reviews.Content: Hello to all at The McLaren Hotel , I'm writing to thank Owen, Billy and Chris. Myself and the whole group of our "Charlie's Angels" walking team thoroughly enjoyed our 2 nights at The McLaren Hotel. It was the most friendly, relaxed and homely place to stay for our weary Oxfam Trailwalker Girls. You all went that extra bit to invent parking space for us at the end of our epic walk, or reorganize rooms to allow us more room. Please pass this message onto all the staff as they deserve our warmest thanks. I will highly recommend The McLaren to others . P.S. I apologize for the their noise after completing the race, and the next morning at breakfast, they were just so pleased to be alive !!!! Kindest Regards Will Johnson

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: HillBillyLeura
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. My wife was in the Mater Hospital for the 5 days I was at McLaren and it was only a 10 minute walk away. It's a great location, being in a quiet street and yet so close to Crows Nest and North Sydney (both within walking distance). There are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby and it's close to Sydney CBD but without all the noise and crowds. It has the ambience of an older style guesthouse more than a hotel. I am a poor sleeper but I slept soundly there. Breakfast is fine if you're happy with cereals, fruit and toast/crumpets as I am. I mentioned that I liked Weetbix and Chris the Manager actually bought some for me. The staff were all calling me by name and I felt at home. I'd certainly stay at the McLaren again and hope to do so in the future.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT OLD FASHION SERVICE !!”
Reviews.Author: Headchef57
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business , its in a good location and good value for money in Sydney. The service is excellent. Rooms are a nice size , clean and comfortable.Plenty restaurants near bye to chose from.

Reviews.Title: “Charming building and neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Whats4dessert
Reviews.Content: McLaren Hotel is not in the middle of the city center but that is an asset after a day of sightseeing or walking about town. The room was clean and spacious, and the decor was fitting to this historical building. It is located in a quiet and walkable neighborhood with a Saturday morning market across the street. Not having free wi-fi is an inconvenience but it appears the owner is aware of the common concern and will address it when he is financially able. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home!”
Reviews.Author: Dellgaye
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at McLaren Hotel several times and always enjoy our time there. During this last visit we were both ill and Owen and the staff could not have been more helpful. The hotel is small and the service personal unlike the large corporate hotels in Sydney. We will definitely stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: chrisMaluaBayNSW
Reviews.Content: A really friendly, home away from home. The people are great, the rooms are excellent and the breakfast room and lounge room are warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: aztsail
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in mid April and enjoyed it very much. It's located about 10 mins walk from the North ydney train station on a side street so it's nice a quiet. The room was comfortable, quite large with air conditioning, although we did not need it. The breakfast was $7/person which is quite a deal and consisted of cereals fruits, toast, coffee, juices. They do also have Wifi for $5. That would be my only criticism. wifi needs to be free. If you're looking for a smaller more intimate hotel experience in a audit location I qcan certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly, and great value.”
Reviews.Author: flowery3
Reviews.Content: A beautiful building on a quiet street greets you as you arrive here, with lovely stained glass windows. The staff here are great - friendly helpful welcoming and informative, you feel like a real person not just a room number. The hotel is lovely, with real character, so you dont feel like you are staying in some bland multinational chain. The king sized bed was large, clean and comfortable, and the room we stayed in had a deck to sit out on, with plenty of natural light. The bathtub was big, the water pressure was fantastic, with endless hot water, and the shower was fantastic...mmm! Just bring your own bath bubbles. though they do proved shampoo and soap. Our room had a heat pump, so if you are sensetive to getting too hot, do ask them for a room with one. They seem to be always aiming to improve things here - previous guests had said that the wireless broadband signal was weak, so they had put in a new box - the signal we had was great ( we had a few other issues with the broadband instead, but they were sorting those out, and were very helpful). The broadband was also very good value ( only $5 for our 3 night stay). The breakfast room was lovely light and airy with glass doors out into to the small quiet garden, where we sat and read the papers over our toast...a simple breakfast but filling and good value. We gave up trying to find a cooked breakfast, as most places were closed over the weekend anyway! And in the evenings we enjoyed the complimentary port - one of the many things that made us feel like welcome guests rather than just customers. Thank you Owen, Chris, and all the staff that were so friendly to your kiwi guests!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: timboc
Reviews.Content: I stay at the McLaren a number of times annually, for business and leisure. It is well-located, has friendly staff and represents excellent value. The rooms are a good size, generally well maintained and those to the rear are very quiet

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lamo0011
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved it. It is a 100 year old boutique hotel with stained glass windows and 13 foot high ceilings. A green leafy, quiet street so close to Sydney. We stayed in the Tara Suite (honeymoon suite) as there were 3x of us and wanted that bit of extra room. There is a large balcony facing the beautiful large street trees. Suite has small kitchenette for extra convience and other lovely peices of furniture. There is sitting room downstairs for guests to simply relax, read the paper and have a small glass of sherry! Has quaint meals area with gardens and free car parking. Bus stop is around the corner on Pacific Highway where there are many buses to catch. Hop off at Wynard bus/rail station then walk around city and to Darling Harbour, can also catch train from there to Circular Quey (one stop) and the rest is history. Can also walk from hotel to North Sydney shopping precinct and dine in style or catch bus and go two stops. Buy MyPass transport ticket, which can be used on bus, train and ferry services. We stayed almost a week and bought the 7-day unlimited use pass. And here's more....Budget rental car is a 2 minute walk to Pacific Highway!! Thank you to Owen and the other staff incluing our lovely cleaner for the best stay ever, will never forget how great it was to experience charming North Sydney and to have stayed in a heritage building. Home away from home...

Reviews.Title: “A little Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Pohughie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago and enjoyed the stay, but this time found it disappointing. It is in a good location, in a quiet street off Pacific Highway in North Sydney with good connections to Chatswood and Sydney City (5 mins walk to N Sydney station). The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff are friendly and helpful, but there are a few things that need a bit of attention. The breakfast is poor and at $7 extra, is just not worth it. Walk to the cafe around the corner and get something much better for $10. TV's are a bit dated and with limited channels. Ours had a faulty remote control and despite a battery change, didn't really work. Lots of places in rooms and common areas where the wallpaper is peeling off the walls, paintwork chipped and generally pretty tired looking. Needs a bit of work on soundproofing. Could hear every movement of the folks in the room above and slamming doors in the corridors. Shame really, as the hotel has a nice feel to it and you get the feeling that with a little bit of attention, it could be a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: ThinController
Reviews.Content: Stayed at McLaren Hotel with colleagues on business trips to Sydney in late 2008 and again in early 2009. While the rooms are are a litle dated, we found the hotel very comfortable. The location is excellent and within walking distance of buses and trains. A couple of minor issues - as one other reviewer has noted the continental breakfast is additional to the room price, and between the first and second stay a small hourly charge was introduced for using the hotel's wireless internet service, which can be difficult to access from some rooms due to the low powered transmitter, which is in the breakfast room. However, it is quite pleasant to sit and work at the tables in the breakfast room, and there is also a computer and printer available in the breakfast room for the same charge as wireless access. What makes this hotel very memorable is the complementary port and sherry offered in the guest lounge room during the evenings, which provides a great opportunity to relax with your colleagues. After our first stay in 2008 we were happy to return on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “McLaren. North Sydeny”
Reviews.Author: Toone
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel every couple of months or so throughout the year. The rooms in the new annex are worth paying a bit extra for. The location is brilliant with buses to the city or northern beaches just around the corner and the train into the city about 5 mins walk away (take the shortcut through Greenwood Plaza). There are numerous cafes and restaurants on Willoughby Road Crows Nest, again just a short walk away. It's a great quiet place to stay so close to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A 'Home away from Home'”
Reviews.Author: OvationGX2
Reviews.Content: The McLaren could be described as a botique private hotel. I've been staying there 2-3 times a year since the late 80's, mostly on business. It's always been clean, friendly, accessible and convenient to North Sydney restaurants and shopping. It's also well placed for access to arterial roads, the Harbor Bridge and the Tunnel. The staff are friendly and eager to assist, the rooms are spacious and comfortable and well maintained. I've recommended the McLaren to friends and associates, and they've always been thankful. It's one of the handful of properties I would call a "home away from home".

Reviews.Title: “Great business traveller hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly atmosphere and very accomodating and flexible staff make this the perfect place for business travellers in North Sydney. Have stayed there on numerous occasions and enjoyed it always.

HotelInfo.Name: McLaren Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 25 McLaren St, Sydney, New South Wales 2060, Australia
